page.title: 06Schools
page.content: Four schools provide education for village children.Whitburn Infant School is composed of a Nursery Unit and an Infant department. Marsden J.M.I.School provides for Nursery,Infants and Junior children.Whitburn County Primary has children from seven years to eleven years and the local Comprehensive School takes the older children from Marsden and Whitburn Junior Schools.Whitburn Infants is a modern school of glass and panel construction.It was built in 1965 and the nursery unit was added in 1981 Marsden J.M.I.was built in 1932 The Nursery Unit was built in 1977Whitburn Primary School was built in 1959 of panel and glass construction.This school is fortunate to have a large playing field.Swimming Baths on the site are shared by other local schools
